item.title: Barrelfish Review - SOSP '09
item.description: Summary This paper presents a multi-kernel OS called Barrelfish for multicore hardware. The authors argued that current OS design and hardware-specific optimization could not exploit heteronomous cores nor suit the diverse, interconnected topology, and messages cost less than shared memory with the development of distributed or event-driven systems. They designed the architecture of Barrelfish structured like a distributed system. It enforced explicit inter-core communication patterns to exploit the high-level knowledge to achieve more efficient cache-line updates.
